Subjective: Left ear feels filled with water, with pain. Pain worse after showering (6-7/10), baseline 3-4/10. Gradual onset 2-3 days ago. Difficulty hearing with left ear. Pain limits swimming. Cleans ears with cotton buds 3x/week. Recently became Dutch citizen. No fever, no general illness. Request: Look in ear, relieve pain, improve hearing. Concern: Worried about ear.
Objective: Vitals: Temp 36.2 C. Right ear: Normal, clear canal, normal eardrum. Left ear: Canal swollen, red, thick. Eardrum not clearly visible. Inflammation noted.
Assessment: Otitis externa (left ear). Likely secondary to water exposure and cotton bud use. Pain and hearing loss secondary to inflammation.
Plan:
- Take Paracetamol up to 4000mg/day PRN.
- Use acidic ear drops (anti-inflammatory) 3x/day for 1 week.
- Avoid cotton bud cleaning.
- Keep left ear dry for 1 week.
- Return to clinic in 1 week for review.
- Return sooner if pain worsens significantly, discharge from ear, or fever develops.
